alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Otsego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 23 at 5:56AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central New York, including the following counties, Delaware and Otsego. * WHEN...Until 900 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 556 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain over the past two hours. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain has fallen and an additional inch of rain is possible this morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oneonta, Hartwick, Otego, Milford, Franklin, Laurens, West End, Emmons, Colliersville, Cooperstown Junction, East Sidney, Sidney Center, New Lisbon, North Franklin, Gilbert Lake State Park, Mt Vision, Robert V. Riddell State Park, Portlandville, Wells Bridge and Index. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
